snippet: Three years ago, Matt Haag was flipping burgers at McDonald’s. Today he makes his living playing video games and has 1.5 million YouTube subscribers.
abstract: Professional video game player Matt Haag makes his living playing Call of Duty, popular series of war games; Haag is face of growing business of video games as spectator sport, and has attracted sponsors like Red Bull, which has organized training sessions for him and his team that are similar to those used by professional athletes (Series: Power Up).
lead_paragraph: Three years ago, Matt Haag was flipping burgers at McDonald’s. Today he makes his living playing video games and has 1.5 million YouTube subscribers.

headline.main: No. 1 With a Bullet: ‘Nadeshot’ Becomes a Call of Duty Star
headline.print_headline: In Gaming, He’s No. 1 With a Bullet
